Case 2: Light damping

If \(k^2-4mn<0\), i.e. \(k^2<4mn\) then the roots of the auxiliary equation are complex:

\(\qquad \lambda_1 = \dfrac{-k+\, i\sqrt{4mn-k^2}}{2m} \qquad \lambda_2 = \dfrac{-k-\, i\sqrt{4mn-k^2}}{2m}\)

Then, after some rearrangement:

\(\qquad x=\text{e}^{-kt/2m} \left[A\cos pt+B\sin pt\right] \quad\) in which \(\quad p=\sqrt{4mn-k^2}/2m.\)
